districts.name: Srikakulam
districts.description: Known for its rich historical heritage and temples, Srikakulam is a coastal district with a strong cultural influence.

districts.name: Vizianagaram
districts.description: A district famous for its forts, palaces, and vibrant traditions, Vizianagaram is a key cultural hub in Andhra Pradesh.

districts.name: Vishakapatnam
districts.description: Also known as Vizag, this coastal city is a major industrial center and a top tourist destination with beautiful beaches.

districts.name: East Godavari
districts.description: Home to the scenic Konaseema region, East Godavari is known for lush green landscapes and the Godavari River.

districts.name: West Godavari
districts.description: A region rich in agriculture and tradition, West Godavari is known for its picturesque lakes and temples.

districts.name: Krishna
districts.description: Famous for its cultural heritage, Vijayawada city, and the Krishna River, this district is an educational and economic hub.

districts.name: Guntur
districts.description: A major center for education and agriculture, Guntur is well known for its spicy chilies and historical significance.

districts.name: Prakasam
districts.description: A district with a blend of coastal and tribal regions, Prakasam is known for its mining and natural beauty.

districts.name: Nellore
districts.description: A major agricultural hub, Nellore is known for its paddy fields, beaches, and historical sites like Ranganatha Temple.

districts.name: Chittoor
districts.description: Home to the world-famous Tirupati temple, Chittoor is a major religious and agricultural district.

districts.name: Kadapa
districts.description: Rich in mineral resources, Kadapa is also known for its historic forts and the famous Ameen Peer Dargah.

districts.name: Anantapur
districts.description: A drought-prone district, Anantapur is famous for its silk industry, historical forts, and ISRO's space research center.

districts.name: Kurnool
districts.description: Once the capital of Andhra Pradesh, Kurnool is known for its rock formations, historical sites, and pilgrimage centers.
